content: The Act is titled the "Paul Wellstone Mental Health Equitable Treatment Act of 2005" and it includes amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 regarding mental health parity. The "Paul Wellstone Mental Health Equitable Treatment Act of 2005" amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to ensure that group health plans provide mental health benefits without imposing treatment limitations or financial requirements unless similar restrictions are applied to medical and surgical benefits. The Act does not mandate the provision of mental health benefits but allows for the medical management of such benefits.
